perturbation.original_text: THI shall reimburse Marv for all IP Costs incurred on behalf of THI, as well as pre-paid IP Costs incurred prior to the Effective Date of this Agreement, including the costs of provisional and non-provisional applications that are filed to preserve Intellectual Property. Reimbursement for pre-paid IP Costs shall be in accordance with 2 (b) 2 above.
perturbation.changed_text: THI shall only reimburse Marv for 50% of the IP Costs incurred on behalf of THI, and shall not be responsible for pre-paid IP Costs incurred prior to the Effective Date of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction regarding the financial obligations of THI towards Marv regarding Intellectual Property costs. Initially, THI was responsible for reimbursing 'all IP Costs', but now is only responsible for 50% and not for pre-paid cost. This creates uncertainty and contradicts the original agreement on the financial responsibilities, specially when it comes to pre-paid costs.
perturbation.contradicted_text: THI shall only reimburse Marv for 50% of the IP Costs incurred on behalf of THI, and shall not be responsible for pre-paid IP Costs incurred prior to the Effective Date of this Agreement, including the costs of provisional and non-provisional applications that are filed to preserve Intellectual Property. Reimbursement for pre-paid IP Costs shall be in accordance with 2 (b) 2 above.

perturbation.original_text: If THI does not make the obligatory payments as stated in 2(b) by the dates stated, the Exclusive License will revert back to Premier.
perturbation.changed_text: If THI does not make the obligatory payments as stated in 2(b) by the dates stated, the Exclusive License will temporarily revert back to Premier for a period of 30 days, after which it will automatically be reinstated to THI regardless of whether payments are made.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction regarding the consequences of THI failing to make payments. The original text indicates the license reverts back to Premier with no conditions, while the modified text states the license reverts temporarily and is then reinstated. This directly contradicts the initial agreement of the reversion of the license, creating uncertainty about the actual implications of missed payments.
perturbation.contradicted_text: If THI does not make the obligatory payments as stated in 2(b) by the dates stated, the Exclusive License will temporarily revert back to Premier for a period of 30 days, after which it will automatically be reinstated to THI regardless of whether payments are made.

perturbation.original_text: Marv shall be reimbursed in full for the cost(s) of all legal expenses associated with this agreement by THI.
perturbation.changed_text: Marv shall be reimbursed for a portion, not exceeding 25%, of the legal expenses associated with this agreement by THI, only upon providing documented proof of necessity and reasonableness of such expenses.
perturbation.explanation: This change contradicts the original agreement regarding the reimbursement of legal expenses. The original text states that Marv shall be 'reimbursed in full' for all legal expenses by THI, while the modified text limits the reimbursement to a portion (25%) and introduces requirements for proof of necessity. This creates a direct conflict on the extent of financial responsibility that THI has in regards to the legal expenses.
perturbation.contradicted_text: Marv shall be reimbursed for a portion, not exceeding 25%, of the legal expenses associated with this agreement by THI, only upon providing documented proof of necessity and reasonableness of such expenses.
